verses.html:
1
’Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
when our hearts lowly bend,
And we gather to Jesus, our Saviour and friend;
If we come to Him in faith, His protection to share,

verses.label: 1C
verses.html:
1
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!
Blessed hour of prayer, Blessed hour of prayer;
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!

2
’Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
when the Saviour draws near,
With a tender compassion, His children to hear;
When He tells us we may cast at His feet ev'ry care,

verses.label: 2C
verses.html:
2
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!
Blessed hour of prayer, Blessed hour of prayer;
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!

3
’Tis the blessed hour of prayer,
when the tempted and tried
To the Saviour who loves them their sorrow confide;
With a sympathizing heart He removes ev'ry care;

verses.label: 3C
verses.html:
3
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!
Blessed hour of prayer, Blessed hour of prayer;
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!

4
At the blessed hour of prayer,
trusting Him we believe
That the blessings we’re needing we’ll surely receive;
In the fulness of this trust we shall lose ev'ry care;

verses.label: 4C
verses.html:
4
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!
Blessed hour of prayer, Blessed hour of prayer;
What a balm for the weary!
Oh, how sweet to be there!
